messages.content:
Dear Resident,
My name is Liz Webster and I'm delighted to be standing as your Liberal Democrat Parliamentary Candidate for The Cotswolds. When I ask residents across the constituency what matters most to them in this election they often ask me in return, 'Why are you standing?' The answer is simple, I want to help make the Cotswolds a better place to live and work for everyone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide support for the NHS and schools and ensure they are well resourced.
Create meaningful prospects and good employment opportunities.
Advocate for a People's Vote to resolve Brexit.
Address the growing environmental crisis affecting local businesses and homes.

issues.brexitEurope: Many residents are worried about Brexit, too, because it threatens the fabric of our society and our Cotswolds rural economy, which is why I believe we need a People's Vote to resolve this difficult and emotive issue.
issues.education: Support our NHS, our schools, and our police, and want them to be well resourced.
issues.environment: Care deeply about the growing environmental crisis which has already directly affected many local businesses and homes.
issues.health: Support our NHS, our schools, and our police, and want them to be well resourced.
issues.labourEmployment: They also need good employment opportunities with meaningful prospects.

community.content: I appreciate our rural and market town communities and the need for more affordable homes so our young people are also have the chance to stay local.

images.caption: Liberal Democrat Parliamentary Candidate for The Cotswolds

examples: I want to help make the Cotswolds a better place to live and work for everyone.
I appreciate our rural and market town communities and the need for more affordable homes.
They also need good employment opportunities with meaningful prospects.
I appreciate our rural and market town communities and the need for more affordable homes so our young people are also have the chance to stay local.

Many residents are worried about Brexit, too, because it threatens the fabric of our society and our Cotswolds rural economy, which is why I believe we need a People's Vote to resolve this difficult and emotive issue.
Care deeply about the growing environmental crisis which has already directly affected many local businesses and homes.
Care deeply about the growing environmental crisis which has already directly affected many local businesses and homes.
